meanings.definition: The quality or state of being schistose.
meanings.sent1: The schistosities of the rock made it easy to break into layers.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the schistosities of the rock to understand its formation.
meanings.sent3: The schistosities of the stone were so pronounced that it looked like a layered cake.
meanings.sent4: The schistosities of the cliff resembled the pages of a book, each layer telling a different story.
meanings.sent5: The miner marveled at the schistosities of the ore, each layer revealing a different shade of color.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a rock to split along parallel planes.
meanings.sent1: The schistosities of the boulder allowed it to split easily into flat pieces.
meanings.sent2: The mountain showed clear schistosities, with layers splitting neatly along parallel lines.
meanings.sent3: The schistosities of the rock were so perfect that it almost seemed like nature's way of making puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent4: The schistosities of the stone were like nature's own pre-cut building blocks, ready to be assembled.
meanings.sent5: The hiker admired the schistosities of the cliff, each layer a testament to the earth's history.
